utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait a minute, wait. You're telling me this actress person is the only woman you ever wanted who didn't want you back?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Oh my God! Is this what it's like to be you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow, you're really crazy about her, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, you have no idea. And-and when we're on stage I get to-to kiss her and-and touch her, but then she goes home with the director, and it's like somebody's ripping out my heart!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it's so great to see you feeling like this!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica, uh Dad called this morning and ah, Aunt Silvia passed away.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We were all pretty shaken up about it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, am I missing something though? 'Cause I thought death was something that's supposed to be sad, in a way.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well ah, Aunt Silvia was, well not a nice person.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch! And I'm sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You get the dollhouse.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I get the dollhouse!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, a house for dolls, that is so cool! When I was kid, I had a barrel.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, Pheebs, you had a barrel for a dollhouse?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, just a barrel.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know what, you can play with my dollhouse.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?! Really?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Any time you want. Y'know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to play with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My Grandmother used to say that exact same thing to me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, Sophie!

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Hey, Rach!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks for lunch, Chandler. Y'know, you didn't have to walk me all the way back up here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, that's-that's okay, no problem.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey um, honey, you do realise that we don't keep the women's lingerie here in the office?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I realise that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Summer catalogue!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's the stuff!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Rachel, I need the Versachi invoice. Hello! You don't work for me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing Joanna.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Bing! That's a great name.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks, it's ah, Gaelic, for 'Thy turkey's done.' So ah, I'm gonna go, nice, nice meeting you.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: So ah, what's wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, nothing, he's just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice it anymore.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No!! No! He's not married, or involved, with anyone!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh, Rachel, actually, y'know what, forget it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I'll ask him for you, if you want me too?

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and y'know something that Sophie would do?

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Uh, uh, uh, I am here.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: I know that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpaper's a little faded, that's okay. Carpet's a little loose. Hardwood floors!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It's so beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, I'm here, ready to play.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That's a dog, every house should have a dog.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Not one that can pee on the roof.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, maybe it's so big because the house was built on radioactive waste.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And is this in case the house sneezes?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, that's the ghost for the attic.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't want a ghost.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you've got one, because the house is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient Indian burial ground? That would never happen.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, obviously you don't know much about the U.S. government.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I need to talk to you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure, what's up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I-I know. Well if something comes up...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I'm glad you guys are past that little awkward phase.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about you...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checkin' out the Chan-Chan man!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That was surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you interested at all?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I'll do it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she's gonna love me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the house!! Ahh-ahh! Roof! Rrroof-roof-roof!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, Phoebe, y'know what? That-that's it, that's it, all right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They're not the right size, they're not Victorian, and they just don't go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Come dinosaur, we're not welcome in the house of no imagination.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, Pheebs, while we're hovering around the subject. I just have to say dinosaurs, they-they don't go, rrroof!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: The little ones do.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Kate!

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last week...

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was good, yeah...

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi, oh, I'm Lauren, Kate's understudy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: I know! I-I'm a big fan of yours.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Get out of here, really?!

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Absolutely!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: They gave me the shaft all right.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Oh, you're so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing after rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well Ahh, yeah! Yeah, sure, a drink sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Cool! I-I'll see you then.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: All right, it's time to act, my talking props.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Look, look!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, what's this?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay, it's the slide instead of stairs. Watch this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's very interesting, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come over, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is the coolest house ever!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I would!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Watch, watch.

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: Ooohhhh!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And, and!

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: Ahhhh!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, my Father's house does that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there's nothing like a cool, crisp New York evening.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Of course, I didn't get to enjoy any of that, because Joanna's such a big, dull dud!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Chandler is fantastic!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh God, we just clicked! Y'know how people just click? Like he came by to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh, and he's got such a good heart! Doesn't he have a good heart?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I know...

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh, I know and he's soo sweet! Listen, he said he was going to call, so put him straight through.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Isn't this great?!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Don't spoil it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on baby, don't go. Please? What do you say?

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Hello. Oh! It's you. Just ah, just one-one sec. I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, committing to the moment!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That guy's like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater you're dating.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I'm not interested in her sweater! It's what's underneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who I'm going out with?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: I don't care. Why, do you want me to care?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you want me to want you to care?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Do you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Okay, I'm afraid to say this, but let's pick it up where we left off.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on baby, don't go. Please? What do you say?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: I've got no reason to stay.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a terrible play! I'll see you in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: I can't believe we go on in, in a week.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, it's gonna be all right.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Hey! So since we're getting off early, do you want to go and paint mugs?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: You know! At the place I told you about last night?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah, y'know what, I think I kinda need to work on my stuff tonight.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: I'll see you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: G'night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we gonna do about this scene, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Well, Adrian's looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can't just kiss her, he's gotta, gotta really give her a reason, y'know?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe he could slip her the tongue.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his waist.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his stomach!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and, and, and bite her!

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this raw, animal....

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Something like that?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yeah, that's pretty much what I had in mind.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's a little early to be drinkin'.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You're kidding?! That's great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, it was so amazing. After the love making...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming 'cause, 'cause her eyes keep going like this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm telling ya, Joanna's got it all wrong. Okay? All I said was, 'This was fun. Let's do it again sometime. I'll give you a call.'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, gee. I wonder why she thinks you're going to call her?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's what you say at the end of a date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You can't just say, 'Nice to meet you, good night?'

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To her face? Look it's the end of the date, I'm standing there, I know all she's waiting for is for me to say 'I'll call her' and it's just y'know, comes out. I can't help it, it's a compulsion.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on Rach, when a guy says he's going to call, it doesn't mean he's going to call. Hasn't it ever happened to you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, they always called.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hmm, bite me.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Did he call?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Why?! Why?! He said he'd call. Why hasn't he called?

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Maybe he's intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn't he called, Rachel? Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you are my boss.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well...

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn't tell him not to call me, did you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. I...

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you work for, there are always ways to fix...that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Call her! Call her now!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Multiple, so many paper cuts.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why hasn't he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don't understand. Why? He said he'll call. Why? Why? Chandler I'm telling you she has flipped out, she's gone crazy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, well give me the phone then.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on, this isn't funny. She thinks it's my fault that you haven't called her. You have to call her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, you can't call somebody after this long just to say, 'In case you didn't notice, I don't like you!'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well then you're going to have to take her out again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nooo!! She's really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop thing in the corner of her eye!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't care! I don't care! You are going to have to take her out again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it's actually ended. And, I don't care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right! Fine! But it's just a lunch date, no more than an hour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don't want you setting me up with anybody ever again!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That's fine!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's just a lot of big talk, y'know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mon?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm in the shower!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, fire! There, there's a fire! Fire!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So I ah, talked to Lauren, kinda told her how things were with us. Did you ah, did you talk to Marshall?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'know, about what happened with us.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Nooo. And there's really no reason he should find out, so ah let's not make a big deal about it, okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you can't tell me last night didn't mean something to you. I-I was there, you're not that good an actress.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That's all it was. Joey, I'm-I'm sorry you feel bad, but haven't you ever sleep with a women where it meant more to her than it did to you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nooo.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Hi, Kate!

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Hi, Lauren.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi, Lauren.

utterance.speaker: Lauren
utterance.content: Hi, pig!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, that's okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower massager.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I tried to reach you at work. There's....been a fire.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! Oh my... Oh my God!! What happened?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, we believe it originated here. In the Aroma Room.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right. Did everyone get out okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, the giraffe's okay. And so is the pirate.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh. What is this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No Phoebe, don't look! You don't want to see what's under there!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, the-the Foster puppets!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's not a big deal. It's, just it's right here, and it's all the time.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Well, thanks again for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, this, this was pleasant.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: It was, wasn't it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The food there was, was great.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Wasn't it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So take care.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, this was great. I'll give you a call. We should do it again sometime.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Great! I'm looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sophie's desk.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler!! Are you gonna call her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Noo!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I'm sorry. Okay? I'm weak, and pathetic, and sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you are going to tell her and you're going to tell her now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahhhh -- I'm not going to call you.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I'm-I'm-I'm sorry that I said I was going to when I'm not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, y'know? And this isn't Rachel's fault. It's me. I have serious, serious problems when it comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy, mascara goop. And I'm really sorry, it's just that this is not, this isn't going to work out.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Well, this isn't how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I have to appreciate your honesty.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, o-okay.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: So...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well this is great! I'll give you a call! We should do it again sometime!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, so anyway Beth, what I'm saying is I should've considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I've ah, I've recently learned what's it like to be on your side of it, and I'm sorry. So, do you think you can forgive me? Great. Thanks. Okay, bye. Hello, Jennifer? Oh hi, Mrs. Loreo, is Jennifer there? Oh, she's not home huh? Well ah, actually I kinda need to talk to you too.
